chargeHist.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Felony Conviction)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Felony Conviction)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Angelo Sanders

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Michael Angelo Sanders.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12. 
*Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court as a friend of the Court for Michael Angelo Sanders.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Court in trial on another matter.  Case heard off the record.  Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.  Attorney Michael Chernin accepts appointment.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court on behalf of Alicia H Kort for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a State V. Lee hearing. Upon notification from Thomas Reed, SPD has not appointed counsel. Court gives SPD 3 weeks to appoint counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 12.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Avaughna M. H., Yvonne R. L., Lashina T. H., or any of her children including KND (DOB
12/26/2004)
No Contact Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Michael Angelo Sanders in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Angelo Sanders appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
